channel.title: Hamachi server
channel.description:
Okay, there's a problem.
First i created the server via Hamachi peoples was connecting, evening server show's error. How to fix?

item.title: Hamachi server
item.dc:creator: @VestaPK VestaPK
item.description:
@VestaPK wrote:

[quote=“Natey, post:16, topic:337393”][quote author=FusionLord link=topic=433796.msg3185495#msg3185495 date=1271694795]

[quote author=Natey link=topic=433796.msg3185490#msg3185490 date=1271694503]

I been Coding for a good 2 - 3 years prob longer, I know, but I tryed Hamachi once it failed I Portforwarded sorted, theres a ton Tutorials to Portforward I can give you one right here.

Type: 192.168.1.1 in your address bar at the top of your browser.

Find the Portforward option add UDP / TCP option type 43594 in the port one.

Type CMD in run type ipconfig in Command Prompt, get the IP like 192.168.1.5 (I forgot name of it and ipconfig dont work on this comp so I have Static IP Address) which changes thats why you should get a Static IP Address.

Type the IP you found in the IP text box.

Enter a name in the name box.

Sorted.

Advice, get a Static IP Address.
[/quote]If you “coded” for 2-3 years you would know that not everyone’s gateway is 192.168.1.1

Sorry to correct you all over the place but this is not true some routers
have them set to other numbers.
[/quote]Some, not all of them.[/quote]

And when did I say you said All? Quote that ROFL.

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi server
item.dc:creator: @_ZeroScape `ZeroScape
item.description:
@_ZeroScape wrote:

Its usually either:

Username;
Password; admin

Username; admin
Password; admin

And yes, in 1 leave username blank ;).
Some routers also have the password written on 'em

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi server
item.dc:creator: @_ZeroScape `ZeroScape
item.description:
@_ZeroScape wrote:

The reason it wont work is either
a) You are not connected to a wireless router.
b) It’s not 192.168.1.1 for you.

To find the correct gateway to connect open the start-menu and run cmb.exe.
In the Command Prompt (cmb.exe) type ipconfig and hit enter.

The highlighted ip is the one you want in you browser to portforward.

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi server
item.dc:creator: @Hotmailer Hotmailer
item.description:
@Hotmailer wrote:

Check your Hamachi connection by going to.

Network> Network Sharing Center> Manage Network Connections

And see if the Hamachi connection is Enables or Disabled by right clicking it.

Read full topic
